question: Calculate the sum of the vectors $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -3 \end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 4 \end{bmatrix}^T$. What is the first component of the resulting vector?
Calculate the sum of the vectors $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -3 \end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 4 \end{bmatrix}^T$. What is the second component of the resulting vector?

Calculate the sum of the vectors $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix} -4 & 0 & 3 \end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -1 & -5 \end{bmatrix}^T$. What is the first component of the resulting vector?

Calculate the sum of the vectors $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix} 5 & -2 \end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix} -5 & 2 \end{bmatrix}^T$. What is the first component of the resulting vector?

Calculate the sum of the vectors $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix} -3 & -3 \end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix} 4 & -2 \end{bmatrix}^T$. What is the first component of the resulting vector?
